chefBio: CNZ Burak is a Turkish chef known for his innovative take on traditional Turkish cuisine. He has gained a large following on social media, where he shares his recipes and cooking tips.

recipes.name: Lahmacun
recipes.steps: Mix flour, yeast, and water to make dough Spread tomato paste on dough Add ground beef, onion, and red pepper flakes Bake in oven. 1. Melt the butter and brush it onto the layers of phyllo dough. 2. Mix the finely chopped walnuts with sugar and sprinkle the mixture over the layers of phyllo dough. 3. Roll the layers of phyllo dough into a tight roll and cut into small pieces. 4. Bake the baklava in a preheated oven at 180°C for 25-30 minutes, or until golden brown. 5. In a saucepan, mix water, honey, and lemon juice, and simmer until the mixture thickens. 6. Pour the honey syrup over the baklava while it's still warm.

recipes.steps: Marinate lamb in olive oil and salt Thread lamb, onion, tomato, and green pepper on skewers Grill on high heat Serve with rice or bread. recipes.name: Manti
recipes.steps: Mix ground beef and onion for filling Make dough with flour and water Cut into small squares Fill with meat mixture and pinch edges closed Boil until cooked Serve with yogurt and mint. 1. chefBio: Fatih Tutak is a renowned Turkish chef who has worked in some of the world's best restaurants, including Noma in Denmark and The House on Sathorn in Thailand. He is known for his creative use of local ingredients and his modern take on Turkish cuisine.

recipes.name: Lamb Kebab
recipes.steps: 1. Cut the lamb shoulder into small pieces and marinate with red pepper paste, tomato paste, finely chopped onion, minced garlic, cumin, sumac, salt, and pepper. 2. Let the meat marinate for at least an hour in the fridge. 3. Thread the meat onto skewers and grill over high heat until nicely charred and cooked to your liking.

recipes.name: Manti
recipes.steps: 1. Mix the ground beef with finely chopped onion, minced garlic, chopped parsley, salt, and pepper. 2. Roll out the dough into thin sheets and cut into small squares. 3. Place a small amount of the beef mixture in the center of each square and fold the edges to form a small dumpling. 4. Boil the manti in salted water until cooked through. 5. Serve with yogurt and sumac.

recipes.name: Sea Bass
recipes.steps: 1. Clean and fillet the sea bass. 2. Season the fish with salt and pepper, and drizzle with olive oil. 3. Grill the fish over medium-high heat until cooked through, about 4-5 minutes per side. 4. Squeeze fresh lemon juice over the fish and sprinkle with chopped dill.

recipes.name: Turkish Delight
recipes.steps: Mix cornstarch, sugar, and water in a pot Cook until thick Add rose water, citric acid, and food coloring Pour into a pan and let cool. into cubes and dust with powdered sugar.
